## isCapitalized() function

is a words first character uppercase and is a following character not upper case? true: {`A`<!-- -->, `Aa`<!-- -->, `.A`<!-- -->, `.a`<!-- -->, `A.`<!-- -->, `AaA`<!-- -->} false: {`a`<!-- -->, `aA`<!-- -->, `AA`<!-- -->}

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function isCapitalized(word: string): boolean;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  word | <code>string</code> | string to check is capitalized |

<b>Returns:</b>

`boolean`
